title: Circadian Rhythm

description.plain:
Drake steps into the time machine on “Circadian Rhythm”, serving as a sequel track to “The Language”, a deep cut off of Drake’s 2013 classic, Nothing Was The Same.

The track was dropped on Drake’s parody Instagram account, after he previously released 100 GIGS of content, including three songs just weeks prior. Similarly, this song was released alongside two other tracks: “No Face” and the highly-anticipated “SOD”.

The songs title could very well be a reference to Kendrick Lamar’s Drake diss “6:16 in LA”, where Kendrick raps:

I know this type of power is gon' cost
But I live in circadian rhythms of a shooting star

Additionally, the first verse in the original “The Language” track was directed at Kendrick after his Control and BET Cypher seemingly referencing Drake back in 2013.

embed_content: Read “Circadian Rhythm” by Drake on Genius

body.plain:
Drake steps into the time machine on “Circadian Rhythm”, serving as a sequel track to “The Language”, a deep cut off of Drake’s 2013 classic, Nothing Was The Same.

The track was dropped on Drake’s parody Instagram account, after he previously released 100 GIGS of content, including three songs just weeks prior. Similarly, this song was released alongside two other tracks: “No Face” and the highly-anticipated “SOD”.

The songs title could very well be a reference to Kendrick Lamar’s Drake diss “6:16 in LA”, where Kendrick raps:

I know this type of power is gon' cost
But I live in circadian rhythms of a shooting star

Additionally, the first verse in the original “The Language” track was directed at Kendrick after his Control and BET Cypher seemingly referencing Drake back in 2013.
